intro: Anneslia densifolia, commonly known as the dense-leaved anneslia, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Acanthaceae and is characterized by its dense, velvety foliage and clusters of small, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun to partial shade. Its flowers, which range in color from white to pink, bloom in late spring to early summer. Anneslia densifolia is often cultivated for its ornamental value and ability to attract pollinators.
